tool.name: EAP fastQ evaluation
tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
Evaluates a single fastQ file of reads using FastQC, before further analysis may be performed. An *ENCODE3 Analysis Pipeline* involves multiple steps and dataset replicates, of which this is one. Use *EAP workflows* to ensure that all analysis steps are performed in the proper sequence.
**Inputs:** All *Analysis Pipeline* steps require **Genome Assembly** and **Experiment Type**. Currently only the GRCh37/hg19 reference is supported. Note that some steps are only appropriate for some experiment types.
Enter **Single or Paired reads** to declare whether the reads are contained in a single 'unpaired' reads fastQ or a pair of fastQs for paired reads.
The **FastQ file** contains the high-throughput sequencing reads upon which further analysis will be based. The fastQ files are expected to be contained in a Galaxy library or else uploaded by the user.
The **Replicate** number allows combining multiple replicates into a single analysis. If the replicate number is not incremented then repeated steps will overwrite previous replicate results.
The optional **Analysis Name** field will be used to tie multiple steps together into one analysis, ensuring related files are well named and a single log records all processing taken. If the intention is to run multiple analyses, then providing an analysis name ensures that results from one analyis are over-written by another. Multiple histories for a single user can share the same named analysis, but two separate users cannot.
**Outputs:** This step is expected to produce the following output:
- A directory of files produced by FastQC. - A **FastQ Stats** HTML file linking to these FastQC evaluation results. - A **FastQ Evaluation** file in json format is produced and used as input for later ENCODE3 Analysis Pipeline steps.
The **log** of this single step can be seen under *view details* stdout.
If the outputs are delivered to a location external to galaxy, the **Analysis log** covering all steps of the analysis will be delivered to the same location. Otherwise the log may be found in the directory pointed to by 'tmpDir' as defined in the settings file.
+--------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ ||encPng||All *ENCODE3 Analysis Pipeline* steps provided through Galaxy are run via the same | | |UCSC scripts and third-party tools as the official *Analysis Pipeline*. Just as | | |with the official pipeline, all work is be performed in temporary directories and | | |successful results moved to well-named locations. If the initial input datasets are| | |from a symlinked Galaxy library, results will be moved to the same directory as the | | |inputs and then symlinked back into Galaxy. If the initial inputs do not have a | | |recognizable location outside the Galaxy database, then results will be written | | |back into the Galaxy database as well. | +--------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
